title: CSS Selector Bug: Triangle Rotation Fix
content: ## Triangle Rotation CSS Bug Fixed (v1.6.0.11) **Problem:** Triangle icon in collapsible filter groups didn't rotate when expanded. **Root Cause:** Incorrect CSS selector using general sibling (`~`) instead of adjacent sibling (`+`). **Broken Code:** ```css .group-toggle:checked ~ .group-header .group-icon { transform: rotate(90deg) !important; } ``` **DOM Structure:** ```html ``` **Issue:** - The `~` selector matches any sibling after the checkbox - But we need the IMMEDIATELY adjacent label - The label is associated via `for` attribute, not DOM proximity **Solution:** ```css .group-toggle:checked + .group-header .group-icon { transform: rotate(90deg); } ``` **Why This Works:** - `+` matches the immediately adjacent sibling (the label) - When checkbox is checked, its adjacent label's icon rotates - Also added `display: inline-block` to `.group-icon` for proper transform **Lesson:** - Use `+` (adjacent sibling) for checkbox-label pairs - Use `~` (general sibling) for matching any following sibling - Always test CSS selectors with actual DOM structure
